cp:coreProperties.dc:creator: The MathWorks, Inc.
cp:coreProperties.dc:description:
Bouncing Ball Model
This model calculates the trajectory, over time, of a ball thrown upward with a velocity of 15 meters per second from a height of 10 m. The model demonstrates the use of the 'ReinitDXDTwhenXreachesSaturation' parameter in the Second-Order Integrator block to model this system. This parameter, when set to 'on', forces a reinitialization of dx/dt (velocity in the model) at the instant when x (position) reaches saturation (i.e., when the ball hits the ground). The reinitialized value is calculated by multiplying a coefficient of restitution times the ball velocity, the instant before the ball hits the ground. The Memory block in the calculation loop serves to capture the velocity of the ball just before it hits the ground. The position of the ball is plotted in the upper axis of the scope while the velocity of the ball is plotted in the lower axis.
